intro: Tephrosia lurida var. lissocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tephrosia, is a perennial shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruit. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring trifoliate leaves with lanceolate leaflets. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish-white, arranged in racemes, and it produces small, flat, brown pods that contain several seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
